DataElement.preferredName: DNA Crosslinking Agent Sensitivity Laboratory Procedure Bone Marrow Blood-Forming Cell And/Or Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cell Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not bone marrow cells or peripheral blood mononuclear cells were tested for sensitivity to DNA cross-linking agents.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: DNA Crosslinking Agent Sensitivity Laboratory Procedure Bone Marrow Blood-Forming Cell And/Or Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cell Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Agents able to covalently bind to DNA causing inter- or intra-stranded cross-linking of DNA.  The cross-linking results in misreading of the DNA code and inhibition of DNA synthesis. (NCI)_Sensitivity; the ability to respond to physical stimuli or to register small physical amounts or differences._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Cells contained in the bone marrow including fat cells, stromal cells, mega karyocytes, and the immediate precursors of most blood cells. (MeSH)_Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._A monocyte found in the general circulation._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredName: DNA Crosslinking Agent Sensitivity Laboratory Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Agents able to covalently bind to DNA causing inter- or intra-stranded cross-linking of DNA.  The cross-linking results in misreading of the DNA code and inhibition of DNA synthesis. (NCI):Sensitivity; the ability to respond to physical stimuli or to register small physical amounts or differences.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.definition: An agent able to covalently bind to DNA causing inter- or intra-stranded cross-linking of DNA.  The cross-linking results in misreading of the DNA code and inhibition of DNA synthesis. (NCI)
The ability to respond to physical stimuli or to register small physical amounts or differences.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Bone Marrow Blood-Forming Cell And/Or Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cell Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: Cells contained in the bone marrow including fat cells, stromal cells, mega karyocytes, and the immediate precursors of most blood cells. (MeSH):Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options:A monocyte found in the general circulation.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: A hematopoietic stem cell found in the bone marrow.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
A peripheral blood cell with a single nucleus. This category includes lymphocytes and monocytes.
Executed and carried through to completion.
